title: 2-on-0 Alley-Oop Partner Warm-Up Game
desc: This is a fun warm-up game for players of all ages. Players are encouraged to be as creative as possible throwing the ball off the backboard. The partner must then shoot a one-hand tip in. Players should always approach from different angles, changing roles every few reps. This is a great way to work on varied jumps/ landings, as well as opening up degrees of freedom in finishing.

title: 1-on-3 Piranha Dribbling
desc: Piranha dribbling was invented by Coach Jonas de Bruyne while working with Alex at College Prep. One player must try to stay alive for 30 seconds, while the other players are piranhas. The 'piranhas' have one chance to steal the ball when they enter the paint. If they cannot get it within one strike, they must exit to a different side that they did not attack from. Once they get two feet outside the paint, they can enter again. Players get a point each time they achieve a successful bite (aka steal)! Change rounds each 30 seconds and manipulate constraints accordingly.

title: 1-on-1 Blind, Throw off Glass and Play
desc: The offense will start in front of the basket, facing the rim, and the defender starts behind them with the the ball. The defender will throw the ball off the backboard in an unpredictable manner. The offense has to secure the rebound from different positions, scoring a gold medal shot before the defender can recover to contest or block the shot. Constraints can be changed here in multiple ways.

title: 1-on-1 Fake-out Drible Start, Must 1 Sec Hesi/ Freeze
desc: "Fake out" was one of the favourite activities that Alex and his staff used at College Prep to encourage deception. One player begins in front of the defense, dribbling in any location. The offensive player attempts to 'fake out' the defender by getting them to move before they actually go. Every time the defender moves before the offense has actually started (moving both feet - note they are allowed to lift their free foot), the offense gets a bonus point. This leads to all sorts of deceptive behaviours and hesis emerging. This is a really fun activity that you can also play off the catch vs off the dribble (which leads to different types of jab step emerging without being taught explicitly). An additional constraint in used in this version, where the offense must hesi/ freeze for a one thousand count after they have started their rep.

title: 1-on-2 Stay Alive
desc: In 1-on-2 stay alive, the handler must keep their dribble alive for 5 seconds before attacking. If they are able to succeed in achieving this, the live 1-on-2 then commences. For more variability, have the second defender start in various positions. Constrain the areas the defense can play in if it is too difficult for the offense, or force the defense to play with one hand each and the other hand behind their back.

title: 1-on-1 Backpedal with Short Shot Clock
desc: Players need to get into pairs, the offense and defense begin facing each other. The offensive player begins by backpedalling to the three point line, where the defense will pass the ball and begin a live 1 on 1. A short shot clock time is used to encourage the offensive player into decisive actions and quickening their release speed.

title: DL Passing Warm-Up
desc: Did you know that differential learning can be used in passing too? This is great for warm-ups, low stress days or injured players. The players are pushed to pass across long distances, which challenges their self-organisational strategies. They are then prompted to pass as creatively as possible, ensuring they don't repeat the same pass type twice.

title: 2-on-2 PNR Guided, Explaining Bingo Opportunity
desc: In this video, Alex introduce the bingo coverage solution for the first time. This is particularly useful against aggressive coverages (e.g. switch and show). Alex then shows how guided defense can be used to develop the ability of the PNR handler to "bingo."

desc: none

title: October 2025: Program Building & Zone Offense with Liam Jefferson

title: How to Use the Activity Library
desc: none

title: Crosscourt Touchdown Animal Movements
desc: Split into teams, players can only move around the space in animal-like movements of their choice, failure to do this results in a turnover, the team’s objective is to get from one side of the constrained area to another. However once tagged the tagged player must remain stationary and pass the ball to another teammate to resume the play.

title: Crosscourt Touchdown Crab
desc: Split into teams, players can only move around the space in crab-like movements, side to side, failure to do this results in a turnover, the team’s objective is to get from one side of the constrained area to another. However once tagged the tagged player must remain stationary and pass the ball to another teammate to resume the play.

title: Crosscourt Touchdown Crawling
desc: Split into teams, players can only move around the space by crawling, failure to do this results in a turnover, the team’s objective is to get from one side of the constrained area to another. However once tagged the tagged player must remain stationary and pass the ball to another teammate to resume the play.

title: Crosscourt Touchdown Only Weak Hand
desc: Split into teams, players can only pass the ball with their weak hand. The team’s objective is to get from one side of the constrained area to another. However once tagged, the tagged player must remain stationery and pass the ball with their weak hand to another teammate to resume the play.

title: Crosscourt Touchdown Rugby
desc: Split into teams, players can only pass the ball backwards and the team’s objective is to get from one side of the constrained area to another, however once tagged, the tagged player must remain stationery and pass the ball backwards to another teammate to resume the play.

title: Dribble Handball with Balloon
desc: Players are split into teams and put into a constrained space, two goals are made on either end, the objective is for the players to keep the balloon in the air, whilst dribbling the basketball, and score the most goals, a goal is scored when the balloon crosses the goal line.

title: Dribble Handball
desc: Players are split into teams and put into a constrained space, two goals are made on either end. The players also have to be dribbling a basketball whilst playing, players can score by throwing the handball into the goal.

title: Dribbling Dodgeball All vs All
desc: Players have both a dodgeball and basketball, whilst dribbling, players should aim to throw the dodgeball and hit another player to gain a point, the player with the most points win.

title: Pass Touchdown FC, Connection Intentions and Athlete-Led TO
desc: Players are separated into teams of 3 or more, the players need to pass the ball to each other and reach the other side of the court without having the ball stolen by the defenders when a player catches the ball they cannot move.

title: Pass Touchdown FC, Two Different Games Simultaneously
desc: Players are separated into teams of 3 or more, the players need to pass the ball to each other and reach the other side of the court without having the ball stolen by the defenders. This time multiple games occur in the same area and players are given one dribble once the ball is caught

title: Pass Touchdown FC, Two Games, Dribble Constraints
desc: Players are separated into teams of 3 or more, the players need to pass the ball to each other and reach the other side of the court without having the ball stolen by the defenders. This time players get two dribbles per catch however only one dribble can be in the forwards direction.

title: Touch Rugby
desc: Players are separated into two teams, the objective is to reach the other end of the court within three touches, players can only pass the ball backwards, once touched players must remain stationary and pass the ball backwards to another teammate to resume the play.

title: Basketball Tennis, Rush the Net Option
desc: Players in pairs are put into a constrained space, players have one bounce of the ball to each other, above their knees. Players get points when the opponent can either not return the shot or an opponent bounces the ball out of bounds. This time players can also get a point by rushing the opponents net and getting a steal or deflection.

title: Basketball Tennis
desc: Players in pairs are put into a constrained space, players have one bounce of the ball to each other, above their knees. Players get points when the opponent can either not return the shot or an opponent bounces the ball out of bounds.

title: Barefoot Isometrics Ankle Rockers
desc: Players balance on one foot on a raised ledge and change the height of their other foot in the air by raising it to different heights.

title: Barefoot Isometrics Varied Ankle Positions
desc: Players balance their feet on a raised ledge for ten seconds then rotate the angle there are facing by 90 degrees each repetition.

title: Barefoot Isometrics, Toe Surface Interaction
desc: Players balance for ten seconds with their big toe on a raised surface, after this they complete the same exercise with their little toe.

title: Barefoot Yielding Plyos with Perturbations
desc: Players separate into pairs and face each other. One player has their hands on the other players shoulder and jumps up and down continuously landing on their toes. This time the jumping player will receive a slight push and have to land in various different ways on balance.

title: Barefoot Yielding Plyos
desc: Players separate into pairs, one player is behind the other and holds the front players shoulder, the rear players jump up and down continuously landing on their toes.

title: Battle Arms Locked Frontal, Over Line to Win
desc: Players get into pairs and have their hands on each other’s shoulders and choose a line to work with. The objective of the game is for a player to be able to push another player over the line

title: Battle Arms Locked Frontal
desc: Players get into pairs of the same athleticism, and have their hands on each other’s shoulders, they then battle each other by pushing the other player.

title: Battle Lateral, Hips Only
desc: Players get into pairs of the same athleticism, and stand shoulder to shoulder, they then battle each other by pushing the other player using their hips only.

title: Dynamic Movements Variable Lunges
desc: Players work on lunging in different directions and different speeds, the same movement cannot be repeated.

title: Partner Jumps with Perturbations
desc: Players get into pairs, one player will jump in the air and the other will safely push then from different angles whilst in the air. The player should aim to land as quietly as possible.

title: Plank Position Partner Interaction
desc: Players get into pairs on with be the plank, and must be as stiff as possible, the other player will tilt the plank player in different directions without dropping them.

title: PVC Pipe Get-Ups, Pipe Can't Touch Floor
desc: Players all have a PVC pipe and begin on their back, players must get up off the floor without the PVC pipe touching the floor.

title: PVC Pipe Matrix
desc: Players pair up, one player remains stationary whilst the other tires to touch the player with a PVC pipe. The stationary player needs to work on avoiding the pipe and cannot move his feet from his position.

title: PVC Pipe Movement Position Exploration
desc: Players all have a PVC pipe and have to explore different positions whilst holding the PVC pipe, one end of the PVC pipe must remain grounded to the floor.

title: Bearcrawl Tag
desc: Players are in pairs and get into a bear crawl stance, they then both must try to touch each other’s hips from this stance

title: Dribble Tag All vs All
desc: As a team a small group of players are nominated to be taggers, taggers have a cone and must pass it onto another player when they tag them

title: Pass Tag with Obstacles
desc: none

title: Pull the Tail, Weak Hand Dribble Only
desc: Players all have a bib tucked into their shorts, whilst dribbling with their weak hand players get points for taking other players bibs away from them.

title: Pull the Tail
desc: Players all have a bib tucked into their shorts,  players get points for taking other players bibs away from them

title: Team Relay Tag with Obstacles
desc: Players are separated into teams and everyone has a ball, a small portion of the players will be in a constrained space, taggers start on the baseline, one by one taggers will be released into the space and go to try and tag the dribbling players in a set time. Non tagged players can use obstacles to escape from the tagging players.

title: Team Relay Tag with Taggers Dribbling
desc: Players are separated into teams and everyone has a ball, a small portion of the players will be in a constrained space, taggers start on the baseline, one by one taggers will be released into the space and go to try and tag the dribbling players in a set time.

title: Team Relay Tag
desc: Players are separated into teams, a small portion of the players will be dribbling in a constrained space, taggers start on the baseline, one by one taggers will be released into the space and go to try and tag the dribbling players in a set time.

title: Trash Can Dunk Tail Tag, Changing Constraints
desc: Players get into pairs and the tagger is facing away from the scorer. A ball is released randomly from behind the scorer, once this happens the scorer is aiming to score in one of the bins and the tagger is looking to tag them before they can reach the bins. This time the angle or positions of the bins can be altered and changed by non-participating players or coaches.

title: Trash Can Dunk Tail Tag
desc: Players get into pairs and the tagger is facing away from the scorer. A ball is released randomly from behind the scorer, once this happens the scorer is aiming to score in one of the bins and the tagger is looking to tag them before they can reach the bins.

title: Introducing Co-Design Warm-Up for First Time
desc: Players are given the freedom to design their own games. However there must be a decision involved for example this could be a tag game, 1 on 1 game, ect.

title: Movement Exploration Sideline to Sideline
desc: Players start on the sideline, they then have to get to the other sideline as creatively as possible

title: Movement Exploration to Half
desc: Players start on the baseline, they then have to move to the halfway line in different ways, the same movement mustn’t be produced twice.

title: Warm-Up Co-Design in Pairs
desc: Players need to get into pairs, then they need to invent a warm up game or movement that forces them to come up with creative movement solutions.

title: Warm-Up Co-Design with Obstacles Round 1
desc: Players need to get into pairs, they are then given an object and need to invent a creative warmup that incorporates the object.

title: Warm-Up Co-Design with Obstacles Round 2
desc: Players need to get into pairs, they are then given an object and need to invent a creative warmup that incorporates the object.

title: Warm-Up Co-Design with Obstacles Round 3
desc: Players are separated into teams, the objective is for one team to reach the touchdown zone, if a player is tagged, they must remain stationary and pass to another teammate to resume the play, if a team is tagged three times the possession is turned over.

title: Warm-Up Co-Design with Obstacles
desc: Players are separated into groups and given a ball and two cones, as a group the players need to invent a game with their given obstacles.

title: Warm-Up Obstacle Co-Design, 1 Minute Rounds
desc: Players need to get into pairs, they are then given an object and need to invent a creative warmup that incorporates the object. Players are given a time constraint of 1 minute to come up with the game. After a minute of playing the game they go to another teams game and play the next one.

title: 1-on-1 Around the Arc, Smaller Advantage 1 Foot Inside
desc: Players get into pairs, the player with the ball starts Infront of the defender anywhere around the arc. The player with the ball can dribble around the arc and once both feet are in the arc the possession is live, however the ball handler can get bonus points for making the defender step inside the arc early.

title: 1-on-1 Around the Arc, Varied Start Positions, Only Two Dribbles Inside
desc: Players get into pairs, the player with the ball starts Infront of the defender anywhere around the arc. The player with the ball can dribble around the arc and once both feet are in the arc the possession is live, however the ball handler can get bonus points for making the defender step inside the arc early. This time the attacking player only has two dribbles inside the arc.

title: 1-on-1 Around the Arc, Varied Start Positions
desc: Players get into pairs, the player with the ball starts Infront of the defender anywhere around the arc in variable positions and movements. The player with the ball can dribble around the arc and once both feet are in the arc the possession is live, however the ball handler can get bonus points for making the defender step inside the arc early or getting the defender to make contact with them.

title: 1-on-1 Blind Start Out of Bounds
desc: Players get into pairs and start from out of bounds. The offensive player has the ball on the back of the defender. Once the ball is removed the possession is live. The play doesn’t stop until one of the players scores.

title: 1-on-1 Chameleon Dribble Start
desc: Players get into pairs and start outside the arc, the defender begins by facing the basket and the offensive player has their hand on the defences shoulder, once the hand is removed the play begins, next the players will stand side to side and the offences hand will be on the defender’s shoulder once removed the play begins, finally both stand facing each other and once the offensive player moves towards the basket the play begins.

title: 1-on-1 Chameleon, Dribble Start, Weak Hand Finish
desc: Players get into pairs and start outside the arc, the defender begins by facing the basket and the offensive player has their hand on the defences shoulder, once the hand is removed the play begins, next the players will stand side to side and the offences hand will be on the defender’s shoulder once removed the play begins, finally both stand facing each other and once the offensive player moves towards the basket the play begins. However, this time players can only use their weak hand to score.

title: 1-on-1 Chameleon
desc: Players get into pairs and start outside the arc, the defender begins by facing the basket and the offensive player has the ball on the defenders back once the ball is removed the play is live. the next start involves the players standing side by side with the ball at the defender’s hip, once removed the play is live. finally, the defender will have the ball and once passed to the offensive player the play is live. throughout the different starts players need to go to new locations each time the same locations should not be repeated.

title: 1-on-1 Through the Branches
desc: Players get into pairs, defending players will get into a T pose Infront of the offensive plyer, the offensive player then dribbles under the arms of the defender to then begin live play.

title: 1-on-1 Tussle Start, Force Weak
desc: Players get into pairs and both the defender and attacker have their hands on the ball, the offensive will then rip the ball from the defender’s hand and attack the basket, pairs should start from new positions each repetition, the defender is trying to keep the offensive player using their weak hand during the live play.

title: 1-on-1 Tussle Start
desc: Players get into pairs and both the defender and attacker have their hands on the ball, the offensive will then rip the ball from the defender’s hand and attack the basket. Pairs should start from new positions each repetition.

title: 1-on-1 Finishing Warm-Up, Two Ball Pass and Exchange
desc: Players split into groups of three, with two attackers and one defender. The defender starts under the rim, the offensive players both have balls and will pass the balls to each other whilst attacking the rim both attackers get one shot.

title: 1-on-2 Finishing Away from Basket, Defense Inside and Outside Paint
desc: Players get into groups of five with two defenders and three attackers, one defender must remain inside the pain with the other outside, attacking players attack the rim all at the same time however must finish away from the basket.

title: 3-on-2 Finishing Outside Cylinder, Defense Inside and Outside Paint
desc: Players get into groups of five with two defenders and three attackers, one defender must remain inside the pain with the other outside, attacking players attack the rim all at the same time, however the finish cannot be inside the cylinder.

title: 3-on-2 Finishing Weak Hand, Defense Inside and Outside Paint
desc: Players get into groups of five with two defenders and three attackers, one defender must remain inside the pain with the other outside, attacking players attack the rim all at the same time, players can only finish with their weak hand.

title: 3-on-2 Finishing, Defense Inside and Outside Paint
desc: Players get into groups of five with two defenders and three attackers, one defender must remain inside the pain with the other outside, attacking players attack the rim all at the same time

title: 3-on-2 Finishing, Varied Pick-Ups, Defense Inside and Outside Paint
desc: Players get into groups of five with two defenders and three attackers, one defender must remain inside the pain with the other outside, attacking players attack the rim all at the same time, this time players have to use different pick ups every time.

title: 3-on-2 Jungle Finishing
desc: Players get into groups of five with two defenders and three attackers, defenders can defend how they want, attacking players attack the rim all at the same time, players have three dribbles to get from the arc to the rim

title: 1-on-1 Finishes Advantage or Neutral, Nash or Backpivot
desc: Players get into pairs and start from a neural position; the offensive player then attacks the rim if the offensive player finds themselves neutral they can use the back pivot or Nash dribble to score.

title: 1-on-1 Finishes, Scripted Cut-Offs
desc: Players get into pairs and start from a neutral position, the offensive player attacks the rim defenders need to work on getting Infront of the attacker and walling up. The attacking player cannot use the same finish twice.</p

title: 1-on-1 Hot Potato, Only Gold Medal
desc: Players get into pairs and play hot potato with the ball when the offensive player chooses they must attack the rim and finish with a gold medal.

title: 1-on-1 Pre-Practice, Players Self-Organize
desc: When players arrive at practices instead of shooting around they can self-organise different games for example 1 on 1 with their own constraints.

title: 1-on-1 Scripted Wall-Up and Play off Backpivot
desc: Players get into pairs and start side by side, then the offensive player will attack the basket and the defender will either give the read to finish middle or baseline

title: 1-on-2 Around the Arc, No Contact, MIG One Step
desc: Players get into groups of three with on attacker and two defenders. The attacking player begins Infront of the defender and can move around the arc with the defender, the attacker ca get bonus points for making the defender touch them.. Once both attackers’ feet are inside the arc the play is live. the third defender is inside the smile and has one step outside the smile to contest shots.

title: 1-on-2 Around the Arc
desc: Players get into groups of three with on attacker and two defenders. The attacking player begins Infront of the defender and can move around the arc with the defender. Once both attackers’ feet are inside the arc the play is live. the third defender is inside the smile and cannot leave the smile but can contest shots.

title: 1-on-2 Chameleon, Varied Start Positions
desc: Players get into groups of three, with one attacker and two defenders, the attacking player has three chances to score however has to start from different depths and angles to the basket. The third defender is helping the on-ball defender however cannot start in the smile.

title: 1-on-2 Chameleon, Starts with Co-Design
desc: Players get into groups of three, with one attacker and two defenders, the attacking player has three chances to score however has to start from different depths and angles to the basket and players come up with new positions and rules. The third defender is helping the on-ball defender however cannot start in the smile.

title: 1-on-2 Crowded Paint Finishes
desc: Players get into groups of four, with two defenders inside the paint and two attackers around the arc, defenders can win the game by getting four stops and attackers can win the game by getting six scores.

title: 1-on-2 Crowded Paint, Co-Design
desc: Players get into groups of four, with two defenders inside the paint and two attackers around the arc, groups can now come up with different ways to change the game and the scoring system.

title: 1-on-2 Crowded Paint, Keep Co-Design, Only Net on Finishes
desc: Players get into groups of four, with two defenders inside the paint and two attackers around the arc, groups can now come up with different ways to change the game and the scoring system. However now players can only score net finishes

title: 1-on-2 Hot Potato, Out to Space Shot
desc: Players get into threes with one defender under the rim and the other two players playing hot potato around the arc. Once the attacker goes into the arc the play is live. However after the attacker has shot the on ball defender will space out to the three and shoot.

title: 1-on-2 Hot Potato, Three Dribble Max
desc: Players get into threes with one defender under the rim and the other two players playing hot potato around the arc. Once the attacker goes into the arc the play is live. the attacker also only has three dribbles.

title: 1-on-1 Continuous Battle
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 situation inside the paint and continuously finish until a set amount of baskets.

title: 1-on-1 Smile 30 Sec Bursts, Must Use Backboard
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will finish, using the backboard, for 30 seconds then the roles switch.

title: 1-on-1 Smile 30 Sec Bursts
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will be finishing for 30 seconds under the basket with the defender defending them

title: 1-on-1 Smile, Defender Can't Jump
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will be finishing under the basket however the defender can’t jump but is live.

title: 1-on-1 Smile, Guided, Only Backboard
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will be finishing under the basket, however the defence will be guided and the offensive player can only use the backboard.

title: 1-on-1 Smiles, Guided, Only Net
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will be finishing under the basket however players can only score net baskets it cannot touch the backboard or rim

title: 1-on-1 Smiles, Offensive Rebound Dynamic Start
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will be finishing under the basket, however the possession starts from a rebound.

title: 1-on-1 Static Start Post-Ups
desc: Players create a 1 on 1 scenario in the smile and the offensive player will be finishing under the basket, however the possession begins from a static post up 1 on 1 position.

title: 1-on-1-on-1 Smile Continuous, Two Balls
desc: In this version of smile 1-on-1-on-1, the players play continuously until one player gets 8 points. There is no need to clear the ball. The defender only becomes an offensive player when they secure the ball on a stop or after the rebound on a make. If players don't communicate score, the basket does not count! This is an important concept to introduce in all SSG's (no score = no basket). This gets player competing and increases the intensity of any small-sided game.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Finish vs MIG Exploration, Varied Spots
desc: Players are in groups with one MIG under the basket, players drive from different angles and must finish in variable ways of two feet away or towards the basket.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Finishes vs MIG, Hang
desc: Players are in groups with one MIG under the basket, players drive from different angles and speeds, they must use the hang finish in variable ways.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Finishes vs MIG, Hop Around
desc: Players are in groups with one MIG under the basket, players drive from different angles and speeds, they must finish by hopping away or around the MIG defender.

title: 1-on-1 MIG, Weakside Slot Drive
desc: Players get into pairs, the MIG must begin from under the basket, the attacker begins from outside the arc, the attacker can only go when the MIG steps out to the lane line and the possession begins.

title: 1-on-1 Train, Finish off Catch vs Weak Side MIG
desc: Players get into pairs and begin in a train start, the attacking player will space out to the arc and receive a pass, as this is happening the MIG defender must touch the lane line and then play defence.

title: 1-on-1 Train, Finish vs Weak Side MIG
desc: Players get into pairs and begin in a train start, the attacking player must dribble out to the arc, as this is happening the MIG defender must touch the lane line and then play defence.

title: 1-on-1 Flip and Slip Finishing
desc: Players get into groups of three, a passer will initiate a side or rub pick and roll, the other attacking player will then flip the screen and slip to the basket the defender remains in the paint and is live once the slip has been initiated

title: 1-on-1 Out and In
desc: Players get into groups of three, a passer will pass the ball to the attacker to initiate the play. Once the ball has been passed the defending player then has to step with two feet outside the arc before playing defence, the play is live from the catch.

title: 1-on-1 Quick Slip or Flip and Slip Finishing
desc: Players get into groups of three, a passer will initiate a side or rub pick and roll, the other attacking player will then flip the screen or slip to the basket, the defender must remain in the smile in a wall up position holding a ball to disrupt the shot.

title: 1-on-1 Quick Slip Out Finishing
desc: Players get into groups of three, a passer will initiate a side or rub pick and roll, the other attacking player  slip either early or on time to the basket, the defender should work on disrupting the slip to the basket.

title: 1-on-1 Scripted Get Keeps vs MIG
desc: Players get into groups of four with two defenders and two attackers a get action is ran from the top of the arc with a scripted defender the player receiving the get action then attacks the basket, the MIG defender is live when the get action is initiated.

title: 1-on-1 Stop and Slip Finishing, Varied Angles
desc: Players get into groups of three, a passer will initiate a side or rub pick and roll, the other attacking player should initiate the pick from different angles, the defender should work on disrupting the slip to the basket.

title: 1-on-1 Train, Finish vs Primary Defender and MIG
desc: Players get into threes with one attacker and two defenders the attacker begins in a train start and has to dribble out to the arc with a defender chasing, the third defender stays withing the smile in a wall up position, the game is live once the attacker reaches the arc.

title: 1-on-1 vs MIG off Roll or Cut, Bad Pass Catch
desc: Players get into groups of three with one passer, one attacker, and one MIG defender. The attacker must make a cut or roll to the basket and receives variable passes from the passer, the MIG has to remain in the smile.

title: 1-on-2/1 Scripted Backdoors Into Guided Shot or Backdoor
desc: Players get into groups of four, a get scenario is created with a weakside MIG defender, the off-ball defender need to play deny coverage to allow the off-ball attacker to cut backdoor for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-2 Find a Window Chaos Finishing, Bounce-Out or Nash Intention
desc: In chaos finishing, players attack at the same time. Coaches or live defenders can be used on defense. Players should get as close to the basket as they can, instead of taking a low value deep floater. If players think it is too congested, they can bounce out (retreat dribble), and shoot a 3PT pull-up off the dribble.

title: 1-on-2+1 Delayed Roll and High Seal
desc: Players get into groups of 4, with a live pick and roll scenario from a side spacing, the picker must variate from using a delayed roll and a high seal, before going for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-2+1 Get Slip Outs Finishing
desc: Players get into groups of 4, a live get action is run from the top of the arc, the player receiving the get can keep the ball and attack the rim for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-2+1 Pocket Catch and Finish
desc: Players get into groups of 4, a live side action is run, the picker will roll to the basket and receive a pocket pass to go for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-2+1 Rub Roll and High Seal
desc: Players get into groups of 4, a live rub action is created, the picker will now create a high seal scenario by rolling short and keeping the defender behind them before receiving a pass for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-2+1 Short Roll Finishing, One Dribble to Get Gold Medal
desc: Players get into groups of 4, a live side or rub action is created with a passive MIG defender, the picker must short roll and then receive a pass for a gold medal finish with one dribble only.

title: 1-on-2+1 Short Roll Finishing, Two Feet
desc: Players get into groups of 4, a live side or rub action is created with a passive MIG defender, the picker must short roll and then receive a pass for a two-foot gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-2+1 Short Roll Finishing
desc: Players get into groups of 4, a live side or rub action is created with a passive MIG defender, the picker must short roll and then receive a pass for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-1 Guided ABC Finishes vs Primary
desc: Players get into pairs, attacking players are looking for gold medal finishes, defenders have three different coverages named A,B,C and will randomly shout the different coverages forcing the attacker to find different finishing solutions.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Finishes Defense, Explore Various Coverages, Only Weak Hand
desc: Players get into pairs, attacking players are looking for gold medal finishes. Defenders are guiding the attackers to a gold medal finish form various angles and different resistance, players can only finish with their weak hand

title: 1-on-1 Guided Finishes Defense, Explore Various Coverages
desc: Players get into pairs, attacking players are looking for gold medal finishes, defenders have to find different ways of guiding the attackers to the basket.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Finishes Introduction with Nash Dribble Option
desc: Players get into pairs, attacking players are looking to use the nash dribble option or gold medal finish if opportunity presents itself, guided defenders can guide the attacker to use either a nash dribble or allow the straight basket finish.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Hot Potato, Out to Space Shot
desc: Players get into groups of three, a hot potato scenario is created around the arc with a MIG defender under the basket, at any point the attacking player can go for a gold medal finish on the MIG defender, the final player then receives a pass for a open three point shot.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Nash or Barkley, Random Surprise
desc: Players get into pairs, attacking players are looking to use the nash dribble option, barkley or gold medal finish if opportunity presents itself, guided defenders can guide the attacker to use either a nash dribble, a barkley or allow the straight basket finish.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Primary Outside Square
desc: Players get into pairs with a guided 1 on 1 scenario, different reads must be given every time, players are looking to finish above the square on the backboard.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Primary Only Net
desc: Players get into pairs with a guided 1 on 1 scenario, different reads must be given every time, players are looking to finish with just the net.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Primary, Intentions of Pace & Tip-In
desc: none

title: DL Finishing, Floaters Highest Arc
desc: Players can work alone, and are aiming to give their finishes the highest arc possible from different locations and using different footwork.

title: OL Finishing, Inside Smile, Only Weak Hand
desc: Players can work alone, and are aiming to use their weak hand only from inside the smile, players should aim to use different speeds and footwork every repetition.

title: DL Finishing, Only Weak Hand
desc: Players can work alone, and are aiming to only use their weak hand from anywhere in the key, players should aim to use different speeds and footwork every repetition.

title: 1-on-1 No Dribble, Must Travel, Defense Can Block
desc: Players get into pairs and set up a 1 on 1 scenario. The offense cannot dribble and can travel as much as they want with the intention of scoring a gold-medal layup. The defense can stop the offense from scoring by any means possible, e.g. using their chest in a blocking stance, as seen in American football.

title: 2-on-0 "Principles of Play" Shooting
desc: Players get into pairs and work on shooting in game like scenarios for example, shooting out of flare screens, shooting out of a get, and others.

title: 2-on-0 Shooting off PNR Set-Up
desc: Players get into pairs and work on shooting out of pick and roll scenarios, with a skip pass, once the pass is complete the ball handler can also receive another pass from a non participating player to get another shot.

title: 2-on-0 Variable Shooting off Boomerang
desc: Players get into pairs and work on shooting out of the boomerang scenario which involves the ball handler giving a pass only to receive the pass back both players will shoot three point shots

title: DL Shooting 2-on-0, PNR Passes
desc: Players get into pairs and work on shooting out of pick and roll scenarios, with a skip pass to the weakside corner

title: DL Shooting 180 Hop, Variable FTs
desc: Players take free throws but have to jump and rotate 180 degrees before releasing the ball

title: DL Shooting Backpedal Threes
desc: Players work in pairs, with one player having the ball in their hands and extending it out. The shooter will touch the ball then backpedal to the three-point line and shoot a shot.

title: DL Shooting Land in a Different Place
desc: Players will shoot a jump shot with the ball but then land in a different place to where they shot the ball from.

title: DL Shooting Partner Co-Design
desc: Players partner up and work in pairs, they have to come up with different ways of shooting the ball and change the solutions every 5-6 reps.

title: DL Shooting Push, Pull, Hold Reactions
desc: Players get into pairs, and have one player driving to the basket, the off ball player has to then react to how the offensive player is driving to the basket and weather they have to push away from the ball, pull towards the ball or hold their position.

title: DL Shooting Range and Location
desc: Players will shoot different shots from different locations every time and they must change the distance they are from the basket each time.

title: DL Shooting Snatch Threes
desc: Players get into pairs with one of the players holding the ball out at different heights, the shooter then has to snatch the ball from the other player and shoot as fast as they can

title: DL Shooting Step-Backs
desc: Players will get into pairs with one defender, the defender will force the shooter to shoot step backs every rep at different speeds and different distances.

title: DL Shooting Variable NBA Threes
desc: Players shoot NBA range threes every rep from different positions and different footworks.

title: DL Shooting Varied Jumps, Alternating Net and Backboard
desc: Players will shoot a variety of shots with different stances and different distances, however every shot has to alternate from a backboard shot and a net shot.

title: DL Shooting Varied Stances
desc: Players will shoot from different ranges and locations and different stances.

title: DL Shooting Varied Surfaces
desc: Players will shoot from different ranges and locations and of a different surface each rep

title: DL Shooting, Alternating Straight and Knee Bend
desc: Players will shoot from different ranges and locations and alternate from being straight to bent every repetition.

title: DL Shooting, Change Location Each Rep
desc: Players will shoot from different ranges and locations

title: DL Shooting, Explaining Short, Medium, Long for First Time
desc: Players will shoot shots from short medium and long distance, players begin at short then progress back but can only progress when they get a swish make.

title: DL Shooting, Five Spots with Varied Contests
desc: Players will shoot from different ranges and locations five times with different contests to their shot each time

title: DL Shooting, Link to Triacors and Dominos
desc: Players will get into pairs with one player calling out different in game scenarios for the shooter to shoot from.

title: DL Shooting, Pass Variability and Changing Locations
desc: Players will move around the arc randomly and receive variable passes from another player for three-point shots

title: DL Shooting, Player-Led Principles of Play
desc: Players will get into pairs with the shooter calling out different in game scenarios to shoot from.

title: DL Shooting, Short Medium Long Introduction
desc: Players will shoot shots from short medium and long distance, players begin at short then progress back but can only progress when they get a swish make.

title: DL Shooting, Sidestep Separation Exploration
desc: Players will shoot three point sidestep shots from different dribble combinations and different footwork.

title: DL Shooting, Explaining What It is for First Time
desc: Players will pair up with players that don’t understand the new differential learning so they can explain the differential learning methodology

title: Introduce BRADs to New Teammates
desc: Players pair up with players that don’t understand the BRAD methodology so they can explain the new concept to them.

title: 1-on-1+1 Curry Shooting, Only C6 Threes or Rim
desc: none

title: 1-on-1+1 Curry Shooting
desc: Players get into groups of three, the defender begins blind to the shooter. The third player begins with the ball and must only assist the shooter in scoring through passes, screens, ect. Once the shooter has spaced to the three-point line the passer passes the ball and the possession is live.

title: 1-on-1+2 Curry Shooting
desc: Players get into groups of four, the defender begins blind to the shooter.  The other two players have to assist the shooter in scoring through screens, picks or passes. Once the shooter has spaced to the three-point line the passer passes the ball and the possession is live.

title: 3-on-2 Jungle Shooting, Only Spot-Up for 2 Sec or Less
desc: Players get into groups of five, players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also two defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots. However offensive players cannot remain stationary for two seconds.

title: 3-on-2 Jungle Shooting
desc: Players get into groups of six players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also three defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots.

title: 3-on-3 Jungle Shooting with Verbal Intentions
desc: Players get into groups of six players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also three defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots. However players must remember that when they are in neutral they should use their relevant triggers to create dominoes.

title: 3-on-3 Jungle Shooting, One Defender Always in Paint
desc: Players get into groups of six players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also three defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots. However one defender must now always remain in the paint.

title: 3-on-3 Jungle Shooting
desc: Players get into groups of six players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also three defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots.

title: 1-on-1 Fakeout
desc: Players play 1 on 1 with the ball handler trying to trick the defender into jumping on a hesitation dribble.

title: 1-on-1+1 Curry Shooting, No Picks Only Gets
desc: Players get into groups of three, the defender begins blind to the shooter. The third player begins with the ball and must only assist the shooter in scoring through passes, screens, ect. Once the shooter has spaced to the three-point line the passer passes the ball and the possession is live. However now players can only use the get trigger.

title: 1-on-1+1 Ghost Screen Contests
desc: Players get into groups of three, a ghost screen scenario is created with a MIG defender in place. The offence stays for two reps, the first rep involves a contested ghost screen, the second rep involves a slip with a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-1+2 Curry Shooting, No Dribbles (Only Screens and Gets)
desc: Players get into groups of four, the defender begins blind to the shooter.  The other two players have to assist the shooter in scoring through screens, picks or passes. Once the shooter has spaced to the three-point line the passer passes the ball and the possession is live. however now players cannot dribble and can only use screens and gets.

title: 1-on-1+2 Curry Shooting, Off-Ball Screen Intention
desc: Players get into groups of four, the defender begins blind to the shooter.  The other two players have to assist the shooter in scoring through screens, picks or passes. Once the shooter has spaced to the three-point line the passer passes the ball and the possession is live. However players can only utilise off ball screens to get into their shot

title: 3-on-3 Jungle Shooting, Intention to Score off Screen
desc: Players get into groups of six players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also three defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots. However scoring off screens results in double points.

title: 3-on-3 Jungle Shooting, Only CES Threes
desc: Players get into groups of six players can only shoot three-point shots, three offensive players say for one minute with two balls, there are also three defenders for one minute. Offensive players can pass, dribble, screen. The goal is to score six three-point shots in one minute, defenders aim to disrupt the shots. Players can now only score catch and shoot threes.

title: 1-on-1 Small Space Stay Alive Can't Turtle
desc: Players get into pair and must get into a small space. One player is chosen to be a defender and has to get as may steals in a certain timeframe as possible. Players get points for steals or touching the ball and if the ball handler shows the defender their back to shield the ball

title: 1-on-1 Small Space Stay Alive
desc: Players get into pair and must get into a small space. One player is chosen to be a defender and has to get as may steals in a certain timeframe as possible. Players get points for steals or touching the ball.

title: 1-on-1 Stay Alive Co-Design
desc: Players get into pair and must get into a small space. One player is chosen to be a defender and has to get as may steals in a certain timeframe as possible. Players can now alter the game and invent a new rule.

title: 1-on-1 Stay Alive, Defense Left Hand Only & Scoring Intention
desc: Players get into pair and must get into a small space. One player is chosen to be a defender and has to get as may steals in a certain timeframe as possible. Defending players can now only use their left hand.

title: 1-on-1 Stay Alive
desc: Players get into pair and must get into a small space. One player is chosen to be a defender and has to get as may steals in a certain timeframe as possible. Players get points for steals or touching the ball.

title: 1-on-1+1 Shield Tag In Constrained Playing Spaces
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two players with balls, one has to be nominated to be a stealer one has to be the ball handler. The extra player is the shield. The shields job is to protect the ball handler from the stealer in any way, the stealer gets points per deflection or steal. The game last until the time constraint has run out. Players now get given cones to make a non uniform shape to play within.

title: 1-on-1+1 Shield Tag with Co-Design
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two players with balls, one has to be nominated to be a stealer one has to be the ball handler. The extra player is the shield. The shields job is to protect the ball handler from the stealer in any way, the stealer gets points per deflection or steal. The game last until the time constraint has run out. Players now also must invent new rules to change the game slightly of shield tag.

title: 1-on-1+1 Shield Tag, Contact Through Shield Intention, Shield One Hand
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two players with balls, one has to be nominated to be a stealer one has to be the ball handler. The extra player is the shield. The shields job is to protect the ball handler from the stealer in any way, the stealer gets points per deflection or steal. The game last until the time constraint has run out. Shields now can only use one hand and the stealer can be more aggressive to get through the shield.

title: 1-on-1+1 Shield Tag, Maximum Physicality
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two players with balls, one has to be nominated to be a stealer one has to be the ball handler. The extra player is the shield. The shields job is to protect the ball handler from the stealer in any way, the stealer gets points per deflection or steal. The game last until the time constraint has run out. Players can now be as aggressive as they want to be this could include lightly pushing the stealer or blocking them.

title: 1-on-1+1 Shield Tag, Shield Constrained
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two players with balls, one has to be nominated to be a stealer one has to be the ball handler. The extra player is the shield. The shields job is to protect the ball handler from the stealer in any way, the stealer gets points per deflection or steal. The game last until the time constraint has run out. Now the shield must play with their hands on their head or behind their back.

title: 1-on-1+1 Shield Tag
desc: none

title: 1-on-1 Advance the Ball, Varied Grid Areas, Four Dribble Max
desc: none

title: 1-on-1 Advance the Ball, Varied Grid Areas, Keep Score and Move Around Intention
desc: Players create a non regular shaped area, one defender is withing the area and the attacker is looking to score a touchdown by reaching the other side of the area. The defender gets a point for steals, deflections, the offence running out of bounds and the offence not reaching the final destination. The offence gets a point for reaching the final destination. Player should mix up their groups to change the people they are playing against, also defenders should count to 5 seconds to make sure the time constraint is kept consistent.

title: 1-on-1 Advance the Ball, Varied Grid Areas, Retreat Dribble Amplified
desc: Players create a non regular shaped area, one defender is withing the area and the attacker is looking to score a touchdown by reaching the other side of the area. The defender gets a point for steals, deflections, the offence running out of bounds and the offence not reaching the final destination. The offence gets a point for reaching the final destination. Player can take as many dribbles backwards as they would like.

title: 1-on-1 Advance the Ball, Varied Grid Areas, Three Dribble Max Not Including Retreat
desc: Players create a non regular shaped area, one defender is withing the area and the attacker is looking to score a touchdown by reaching the other side of the area. The defender gets a point for steals, deflections, the offence running out of bounds and the offence not reaching the final destination. The offence gets a point for reaching the final destination. Players now only get three dribbles to get to the touchdown zone, however retreat dribbles don’t count.

title: 1-on-1 Advance the Ball, Varied Grid Areas
desc: Players create a non regular shaped area, one defender is withing the area and the attacker is looking to score a touchdown by reaching the other side of the area. The defender gets a point for steals, deflections, the offence running out of bounds and the offence not reaching the final destination. The offence gets a point for reaching the final destination.

title: 1-on-1 Gross Court Gauntlet Varied Spaces, Intention to Recover
desc: none

title: 1-on-1 Cross Court Gauntlet
desc: Players are in pairs, players are given 7 dribbles to get from one side of the court to another, players need to make sure they don’t go outside of the constrained space, defenders are given a point if the ball goes out of bounds and offence gets a point if they reach the other side.

title: 1-on-1 FC, Constrained Dribbles and Land Like a Quarterback
desc: Players get into pairs, the attacker begins on one end of the court with the defender standing on the other side along the arc. The attacker rebounds the ball of the glass and is given two dribbles to get to the defender on the other side of the court. After the skate dribble the ball handler can take another dribble towards the basket depending on the option the defence has given.

title: 1-on-1 FC, Constrained Dribbles and Must Skate
desc: Players get into pairs, the attacker begins on one end of the court with the defender standing on the other side along the arc. The attacker rebounds the ball of the glass and is given two dribbles to get to the defender on the other side of the court. Once reaching the defender the ball handler must use a skate dribble

title: 1-on-1 HC Grid, Force Weak
desc: Players get into pairs and work within the halfcourt area,  the defenders must force the offensive player to use their weak hand to get from one side of the half court to the other side.

title: 1-on-1 HC Touchdown Burst
desc: Players get into pairs and work within the halfcourt area the ball handers objective is to get from one end of the halfcourt to another end. The defenders job is to get a steal or stop the ball handler reaching the other side in the time constraint.

title: 1-on-1 Rectangle, Co-Design
desc: Players get into pairs and need to find a box area to work in the ball handler needs to work on getting around the box without having the ball being stolen. Now players can change the game and add new rules.

title: 1-on-1 Rectangle, Retreat Dribble Start
desc: Players get into pairs and need to find a box area to work in. Defenders need to play an aggressive defence to begin with to force the ball handler to use a retreat dribble, once the retreat dribble has been complete the ball handler needs to work on getting around the box without having the ball being stolen.

title: 1-on-2 Gauntlet, Varied Grid Sizes, Defense Can't Move, Four Dribble Max
desc: none

title: 1-on-2 Gauntlet, Varied Grid Sizes, Defense Can't Move
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones, defenders’ cannot move and ball handlers can only use four dribbles

title: 1-on-2 Gauntlet, Varied Grid Spaces
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones, defenders’ movement is constrained to only one step and ball handlers can only use four dribbles with one backwards dribble. This time the gird that the game is played in should be a non uniform shape.

title: 1-on-2 Gauntlet
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones.

title: 1-on-2 HG Gauntlet
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the half court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones.

title: 1-on-2 HC Start, 6 Second Clock
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the half court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones. Ball handlers are now only given six seconds to get to the other side.

title: 1-on- Gauntlet, Defenders Constrained, 7 Dribbles
desc: Players get into groups of four, with three defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones. Defenders now all have to hold a ball with one hand whilst playing defence and ball handlers are only given seven dribbles.

title: 1-on-3 Gauntlet
desc: Players get into groups of four, with three defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler wants to get from one side of the court to another without having the ball stolen. Defenders are randomly allocated zones, along the ball handlers’ path, to play defence in and cannot leave these zones.

title: 1-on-1 HC Start, NBA Spacing
desc: Players get into pairs and begin in NBA spacing, a 1 on 1 scenario is created in a static start position and ball handlers are given 6 seconds to get a gold medal finish

title: 1-on-1 Small Spaces, Sled Resistance Start
desc: Players get into pairs and start in a constrained area playing 1 on 1 for five seconds with the defender applying physical resistance when the five seconds is up the ball handler can then leave the space and attack for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-1 Small Space
desc: Players get into pairs and start in a constrained area playing 1 on 1 for five seconds when the five seconds is up the ball handler can then leave the space and attack for a gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-1 Walking Orbit
desc: Players get into pairs and play in between two baskets; the ball handler can begin by walking around randomly with the defender orbiting them. Then the ball handler decides to they can explode to go for a gold medal finish at one of the baskets

title: 1-on-2 FC, Constrained Dribbles and Land Like a Quarterback
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two defenders and one ball handler. The ball handler must throw the ball of the glass and land on two feet scanning the court then begin a live 1 on 2 scenario in the full court with constrained dribbles.

title: 1-on-1 Straight Line Dribble vs Partner Push
desc: Players get into pairs, the defender must stand next to the ball handler and apply resistance to their unused shoulder whilst the ball handler is dribbling down the court, the ball handler wants to keep a straight line and avoid being pushed of their line.

title: 1-on-1 Circle Tag
desc: Players get into pairs and have two cones placed down, both players are dribbling around the cones trying to tag the other player Infront of them.

title: 1-on-1 Dribble Around Warm-Up Game, Constrained Space
desc: Players get into pairs with one ball handler and one defender the defender is trying to stay Infront of the ball handler with the ball handler trying to dribble the ball around the defender. The space the ball handler can use is now constrained.

title: 1-on-1 Dribble Around Warm-Up Game
desc: Players get into pairs with one ball handler and one defender the defender is trying to stay Infront of the ball handler with the ball handler trying to dribble the ball around the defender.

title: 1-on-1 Dribble Knock Tag
desc: Players get into pairs, players get points for touching other players knees whilst dribbling the ball

title: 1-on-1 Dribble Knockout
desc: none

title: 1-on-1 Dribbling Steal the Cone
desc: Players get into pairs with a cone in-between them, payers begin by free dribbling statically then when a non participating player shouts go the players need to steal the cone in the middle, players get points for stealing the cone

title: 1-on-1 Dribbling, Steal Cone with Touchdown
desc: Players get into pairs with a cone in-between them, payers begin by free dribbling statically then when a non participating player shouts go the players need to steal the cone in the middle, players get points for stealing the cone, coaches can also refer to a side of the court that the players need to score a touchdown in at random points in the drill

title: 1-on-1 Pivot Tag
desc: Players get into pairs with a player with a ball. The player with the ball is trying to tag the other player from a pivot position. The player without the ball also has to use a pivot to avoid getting tagged

title: 1-on Touchdown Tag. 5 Sec Clock
desc: Players get into pairs in a constrained space, the ball handler is trying to reach the other side of the space without being tagged with two hands from the defender, the ball handler has five seconds to reach the other side.

title: 1-on-1 Touchdown Tag, Co-Design, Back to Back
desc: Players get into pairs in a constrained space, the ball handler is trying to reach the other side of the space without being tagged with two hands from the defender, the ball handler has five seconds to reach the other side. However players now have to be facing away from each other whilst playing

title: 1-on-1 Touchdown Tag, Defender Dribbles
desc: Players get into pairs in a constrained space, the ball handler is trying to reach the other side of the space without being tagged with one hand from the defender, the ball handler has five seconds to reach the other side. The defender now also has a ball and is dribbling

title: 1-on-1 Dribble Knockout, Varied Playing Space
desc: Players get into groups of three. Players are also supplied with cones to then create their own playing space. Players then are aiming to knock each other’s balls out of the playing space to give themselves points.

title: 3-on-1 Dribble Knockout, Varied Playing Spaces, Sumo Option
desc: Players get into groups of three. Players are also supplied with cones to then create their own playing space. Players then are aiming to knock each other’s balls out of the playing space to give themselves points. Players now also get points for pushing other payers outside the created playing area.

title: 2-on-1 Dribble Knockout, Varied Playing Spaces, Can't Turtle
desc: none

title: 2-on-1 Dribble Knockout, Varied Playing Spaces
desc: Players get into groups of three, players then are given cones to create their own playing spaces. One player doesn’t have the ball and is a defender, their aim is to knock out the ball of other players to get a point.

title: 2-on-2 Breakout Tag
desc: Players get into groups of 4, and all start from different sides out of bounds from a constrained space, two players have basketballs and are the defenders, all the players must find creative movement solutions to get to the middle of the area, one in the middle the two players without balls must reach the opposite end to where they started from without being tagged by their opponent.

title: 2-on-2 Through Gate, Only Steal Ball of Player Not In Possession
desc: Players get into groups of 4, three players need basketballs. Two players need to be nominated to be stealers, stealers can only steal the bib of the non ball handling player. the two other players have to work together to stop getting caught out by the stealers.

title: 2-on-2 Touchdown Tag
desc: Players get into groups of four, two players have balls and their aim is to stop the non ball handling players from getting to the other side of the constrained space. Both non ball players must be tagged before reaching the touchdown zone for the defenders to get a point.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Pushout and Skates, Disruption Intention
desc: Players get into pairs, the ball handler begins on the halfway line and has one dribble to meet the defender who is on the nba 3pt line upon meeting the defender the ball handler has one skate dribble, during the skate dribble the defender will give different reads for the offence to reach the smile. The offence now only has two dribbles to reach the gold medal finish. Defenders are now trying to be more disruptive to the offence to make the finish harder.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Pushout and Skates, NBA 3PT Start, Two Dribble Max
desc: Players get into pairs, the ball handler begins on the halfway line and has one dribble to meet the defender who is on the nba 3pt line upon meeting the defender the ball handler has one skate dribble, during the skate dribble the defender will give different reads for the offence to reach the smile. The offence now only has two dribbles to reach the gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-1 Guided Pushout and Skates, Three Dribble Max
desc: Players get into pairs, the ball handler begins on the halfway line and has one dribble to meet the defender, upon meeting the defender the ball handler has one skate dribble, during the skate dribble the defender will give different reads for the offence to reach the smile. After the skate dribble the ball handler has one more dribble for a gold medal finish.

title: Dribble Max 1-on-1 Guided Pushout and Skates, Varied Skate Exploration
desc: Players get into pairs, the ball handler begins on the halfway line and has one dribble to meet the defender, upon meeting the defender the ball handler has one skate dribble, during the skate dribble the defender will give different reads for the offence to reach the smile. After the skate dribble the ball handler has one more dribble for a gold medal finish. Ball handlers should look to skate in different ways rather than just using a left- or right-hand skate.

title: 2-on-2 Small Space Keepaway with One Dribble
desc: Players get into groups of four, with two defenders and two attackers, the attackers now have one dribble and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes.

title: 2-on-2 Small Space Keepaway, One Dribble, 2 Sec Clock
desc: Players get into groups of four, with two defenders and two attackers, the attackers now have one dribble and can only pass in the constrained area, players can now only hold the ball for two seconds. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes.

title: 2-on-2 Small Space Keepaway
desc: Players get into groups of four, with two defenders and two attackers, the attackers cannot dribble the ball and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes.

title: 3-on-3 Pass Keepaway with One Dribble
desc: Players get into groups of six, with three defenders and three attackers, the attackers have only one dribble and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes.

title: 4-on-4 Rectangle Keepaway, Boundary Intention
desc: Players get into groups of eight, with four defenders and four attackers, the attackers cannot dribble the ball and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes. Players should be made aware of the constrained space they are playing in and should be penalised for going out of the constrained area.

title: 4-on-4 Rectangle Keepaway, Mantra Constraint
desc: Players get into groups of eight, with four defenders and four attackers, the attackers cannot dribble the ball and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes. No more than two offensive players cannot be in the same space.

title: 4-on-4 Rectangle Keepaway, Magnet Tweak and Intention to Avoid Fouling
desc: Players get into groups of eight, with four defenders and four attackers, the attackers cannot dribble the ball and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes. No more than two offensive players cannot be in the same space. Coaches can now call hand checks and fouls and penalise defence for this.

title: 4-on-4 Rectangle Keepaway, Two Ball Experiment
desc: Players get into groups of eight, with four defenders and four attackers, the attackers cannot dribble the ball and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes. Offence now has two balls to work with.

title: 4-on-4 Rectangle Keepaway
desc: Players get into groups of eight, with four defenders and four attackers, the attackers cannot dribble the ball and can only pass in the constrained area. Defenders are looking to deflect the passes.

title: 1-on-1 Ball Drop Start
desc: Players get into pairs, and need to be close to two baskets, the offense begins by throwing the ball out when the ball bounces the possession is live, the offence then has two dribbles to get a gold medal finish in either basket.

title: 1-on-1 Crossover Step Guided
desc: Players get into pairs, and work with a guided defence. The offence is looking to use a cross step in their gold medal finish with the defence guiding them to this movement.

title: 1-on-1 Force Weak Tussle, Attack without Travelling
desc: Players get into pairs, the defence holds the ball out and the offensive player has their hands on the ball also. The attackers first dribble to the basket has to be with their weak hand. The defender’s aim is to keep the offence using their weak hand during the possession.

title: 1-on-1 Orbit with Co-Design
desc: Players get into pairs and play in between two baskets; the ball handler begins static with the defender orbiting them. Then when the ball handler decides to they can go for a gold medal finish at one of the baskets. Players now can create new rules to change the game.

title: 1-on-1 Orbit with Twitch Bonus
desc: Players get into pairs and play in between two baskets; the ball handler begins static with the defender orbiting them. Then when the ball handler decides to they can go for a gold medal finish at one of the baskets. The offence also gets extra points for tricking the defender into moving to early.

title: 1-on-1 Orbit, Only Gold Medal
desc: Players get into pairs and play the offence begins on the arc the defender is orbiting around the offensive player. the defender cannot play live defence until the attacker takes a step towards the basket. the attackers can only score gold medal finishes.

title: 1-on-1 Tussle Start, Force Weak Guided Defense
desc: Players get into pairs, the defence holds the ball out and the offensive player has their hands on the ball also. When the offensive player goes the defender is guiding the offence to use their weak hand on the finish.

title: 1-on-1 Tussle Start, Force Weak, Putback Intention
desc: Players get into pairs, the defence holds the ball out and the offensive player has their hands on the ball also. When the offensive player goes the defender is guiding the offence to use their weak hand on the finish. When players finish at the rim the offence is looking for a putback finish regardless weather it is a miss or a made basket.

title: 1-on-1 Twitch Off Dribble Start
desc: Players get into pairs and begin in a 1 on 1 with the offence static dribbling, the offence is looking to make the defence move with a twitch which results in them getting an extra point. When the offence has taken one dribble however the possession is live. Offensive players are looking to go for gold medal finishes.

title: 1-on-1 Twitch
desc: Players get into pairs and begin in a 1 on 1 static position, the offence is looking to make the defence move with a twitch which results in them getting an extra point. When the offence has taken one dribble however the possession is live. Offensive players are looking to go for gold medal finishes.

title: 1-on-1+1 Cat and Mouse
desc: Players get into groups of three, with one attacker, one defender and one extra player. the extra player will begin Infront of the attacker. Defence starts by being behind the attacker with both their hands on their shoulders, the offence cant go for a gold medal finish until the defence has moved past the extra player.

title: 1-on-1+1 Variable Hi-5 Off Catch, Avoid Travel Intention
desc: none

title: 1-on-1+1 Variable Hi-5
desc: Players get into groups of three with one attacker, one defender and an extra player standing behind the attacker. The player behind the attacker will hold their hand up at random locations behind the attacker, when this is signalled the defender has to hi five the extra player hand. The attacker can only move when the defender goes to hi five the extra player.

title: 1-on-2 Crossover Step, Hostage
desc: Players get into groups of three, with one attacker, one defender and one MIG. The defence needs to allow the offence to use the cross step. Once the offence has used the cross step, they need to then utilise the hostage dribble before going for a live gold medal finish.

title: 1-on-1 Ball Drop on the Move
desc: Players get into pairs, ball handle tosses the ball into the air and has to be on the move with the ball before the 1 on 1 begins. After this the play is live.

title: 1-on-1+1 BOB Game Winner, Gold, Silver or Bronze Medals, Variable Clock
desc: Players get into groups of three, with one attacker, one defender and a passer who begins from an out of bounds position, the ball is then passed to the attacker to initiate the 1 on 1 after this the passer will call out a variable shot clock of anywhere from 3-7 seconds for the attacker to make either a gold, silver or bronze medal shot.

title: 1-on-1+1 Burst Closeouts, 4 Sec Clock
desc: Players get into groups of four with a passer, an attacker, and two defenders. Offense stays on for 45 seconds. The passer begins at the top of the arc and the attacker will be in a random spacing every repetition, one defender will be on ball with the other waiting on the baseline. Attackers are given 4 seconds to score a basket after one shot the defenders switch.

title: 1-on-1+1 Burst Closeouts, 6 Sec Clock, Re-Trigger
desc: Players get into groups of four with a passer, an attacker, and two defenders. Offense stays on for 45 seconds. The passer begins at the top of the arc and the attacker will be in a random spacing every repetition, one defender will be on ball with the other waiting on the baseline. Attackers are given 6 seconds to score a basket after one shot the defenders switch. The attackers are also given an option to use the passer again to re trigger a possession.

title: 1-on-1 Backpedal Start
desc: Players need to get into pairs, with the offense and defense beginning by facing each other. The offensive player begins by backpedalling to the three point line, where the defense will pass the ball and begin a live 1-on-1. The offense have 5 seconds to score. Starting 1-on-1's with prior movement (especially moving backwards) is a great way to improve footwork and reduce travels.

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
title: 1-on-1 Find Window & Baseline Drift, Out to Space Closeout 3 Sec Clock
desc: none

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
title: 1-on-1 Find Window & Baseline Drift, Out to Space Closeout
desc: Players get into groups of three, with one ball handler, an offensive wing, and a MIG defender, the ball hander drives baseline and gives a wrap pass to the wing defender, after this they space out for a three point shot. However, the MIG defender is looking to stop this pass. Once caught by the wing player they can play live 1 on 1 with the MIG defender.

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
title: 2-on-1 Train Start
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two offensive players and one MIG defender. Then all players must get into a line with the MIG defender at the back of the line and the two offensive players at the front. The player at the front of the line with a ball will throw out the ball to the three-point line for a three-point shot. After the shot the extra offensive player and the defender will play live 1 on 1, from a rebound, until a score.

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
title: 2-on-1 Train, Only Gold Medals, One Pass Max
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two offensive players and one MIG defender. Then all players must get into a line with the MIG defender at the back of the line and the two offensive players at the front. The player at the front of the line with a ball will throw out the ball to the three-point line. After a shot the extra offensive player and the defender will play live 1 on 1, from a rebound, until a score. Players only get one pass on offense and only gold medals can be scored.

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
title: 2-on-1 Train, Only Gold Medals
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two offensive players and one MIG defender. Then all players must get into a line with the MIG defender at the back of the line and the two offensive players at the front. The player at the front of the line with a ball will throw out the ball to the three-point line. Only gold medals can be scored and after a shot the extra offensive player and the defender will play live 1 on 1, from a rebound, until a score.

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
title: 2-on-1 Well Gets, Only Gold Medal
desc: Players get into groups of three, with two offensive players and one defender, the offence then must create a get scenario, the possession is live from this. However the playing space is constrained with a wall in a random location withing the space.

module: Principles of Play - Offensive: Dominoes & Shot Selection
